sections.heading: Loop Through a Dictionary
sections.description: You can loop through a dictionary by using a for loop. When looping through a dictionary, the return value are the keys of the dictionary, but there are methods to return the values as well.

code_blocks.notes: Print all key names in the dictionary, one by one:
Print all values in the dictionary, one by one:

You can also use the values() method to 
return values of a dictionary:

You can use the keys() method to 
return the keys of a dictionary:

Loop through both keys and values, by using the
items() method:
code_blocks.code:
for x, y in thisdict.items():
»»print(x, y)
